name: country-experience-on-mosaicc-asia

resources.description: Assessment of climate change impacts and mapping of vulnerability to food insecrity under climate change to strengthen houshold food secuirty with livelihoods' adaptation approachees (AMICAF) Step 1 - assessment of cliamte change imapcts on agriculture.
resources.name: MOSAICC Philippines climate down-scaling technical report
MOSAICC Philippines - Analysis of climate change impacts on stream discharges using STREAM
resources.description: The goal of this study is to use the hydrological module of the MOSAICC toolbox to estimate river runoff projections under different scenarios of climate change for the major river basins in the Philippines. Historical datasets on climate and river runoff are used for model calibration.

resources.name: MOSAICC Philippine - Statistically downscaled projected changes in seasonal mean temperature and rainfall in Cagayan Valley, Philippines
resources.description: This paper attempts to understand projected climate changes in seasonal rainfall and mean temperature (2011â€“2040) to inform climate change adaptation planning in Cagayan Valley. The climate change projections were provided to crop and water resource modeling, agricultural market modeling, food insecurity vulnerability analysis, community-based climate change adaptation planning, and policy simulation.

This work shows that local-scale climat eprojections obtained by means of statistical downscaling are sensitive to the choice of re-analysis used for calibration.To this aim,a generalized linear model(GLM)approach is applied to downscale daily precipitation in the Philippines.
resources.name: MOSAICC Philippines - Statistical downscaling in the tropics can be sensitive to reanalysis choice: a case study for precipitaiton in the Philipines

organization.name: fao
organization.title: FAO
organization.description: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations

title: Country experience on MOSAICC: Asia

groups.title: Climate change adaptation and resilience
groups.description: Climate change threatens our ability to ensure global food security, eradicate poverty and achieve sustainable development. Greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions from human activity and livestock are a significant driver of climate change, trapping heat in the earth's atmosphere and triggering global warming.
groups.name: climate-change-adaptation

notes: In the framework of the AMICAF project (Analysis and Mapping of Impacts under Climate Change for Adaptation and Food Security), MOSAICC was implemented and used for assessing climate change impacts at local level in the Philippines. These results have been incorporated in a public portal for data visualization and analysis by the national meteorological service (PAGASA). Scientific publications are also available on the website.
